head.supplied: 22/1/94 ¶ ¶ When coming to this weeks mail-work, dear Mr Macdonald, I find that I have as yet not returned to you Major Darwin's letter. ¶ Leonard Darwin, at this date an assistant secretary of the R...

div.p: A38, The Royal Geographical Society of Australasia (Vic. Branch), Mitchell Library, State Library of NSW, Sydney.

When coming to this weeks mail-work, dear Mr Macdonald, I find that I have as yet not returned to you Major Darwin's letter.
Leonard Darwin, at this date an assistant secretary of the Royal Geographical Society.Letter not found. Mhad been invited to be anHonorary Vice-President of thesixth International Geographical Congressto be heldin Londonin August 1895. The invitation wasalluded to inM to A. Macdonald, 17 January 1894;seenotes theretoandKeltie & Mill (1896), p. 5.
Will you kindly reply as Hon. Secr. of our branch officially, acknowledging the honor done us, assuring the home Soc. of our desire of aiding the Congress, but pointing out, that advanced age and with my local professional responsibilities I should find it impossible to attend personally at this great international gathering of geographers.
We must make at the next Council-Meeting special arrangements, how to aid this congress by timely efforts.
